name: Intl.Locale()
description: Creates a new Locale object.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: The Unicode locale identifier string. For the syntax of locale identifier strings, see the Intl main page. Note that the Intl.Locale constructor, unlike most other Intl constructors, does not accept an array of locales or undefined.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description:
An object that contains configuration for the Locale. Option values here take priority over extension keys in the locale identifier. Possible properties are:

language

The language. Any syntactically valid string following the unicode_language_subtag grammar (2â3 or 5â8 letters) is accepted, but the implementation only recognizes certain kinds.

script

The script. Any syntactically valid string following the unicode_script_subtag grammar (4 letters) is accepted, but the implementation only recognizes certain kinds.

region

The region. Any syntactically valid string following the unicode_region_subtag grammar (either 2 letters or 3 digits) is accepted, but the implementation only recognizes certain kinds.

calendar

The calendar. Any syntactically valid string following the type grammar (one or more segments of 3â8 alphanumerals, joined by hyphens) is accepted, but the implementation only recognizes certain kinds, which are listed in Intl.Locale.prototype.getCalendars.

collation

The collation. Any syntactically valid string following the type grammar is accepted, but the implementation only recognizes certain kinds, which are listed in Intl.Locale.prototype.getCollations.

numberingSystem

The numbering system. Any syntactically valid string following the type grammar is accepted, but the implementation only recognizes certain kinds, which are listed in Intl.Locale.prototype.getNumberingSystems.

caseFirst

The case-first sort option. Possible values are "upper", "lower", or "false".

hourCycle

The hour cycle. Possible values are "h23", "h12", "h11", or the practically unused "h24", which are explained in Intl.Locale.prototype.getHourCycles

numeric

The numeric sort option. A boolean.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The language. Any syntactically valid string following the unicode_language_subtag grammar (2â3 or 5â8 letters) is accepted, but the implementation only recognizes certain kinds.

parameters.name: script
parameters.description: The script. Any syntactically valid string following the unicode_script_subtag grammar (4 letters) is accepted, but the implementation only recognizes certain kinds.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: The region. Any syntactically valid string following the unicode_region_subtag grammar (either 2 letters or 3 digits) is accepted, but the implementation only recognizes certain kinds.

parameters.name: calendar
parameters.description: The calendar. Any syntactically valid string following the type grammar (one or more segments of 3â8 alphanumerals, joined by hyphens) is accepted, but the implementation only recognizes certain kinds, which are listed in Intl.Locale.prototype.getCalendars.

parameters.name: collation
parameters.description: The collation. Any syntactically valid string following the type grammar is accepted, but the implementation only recognizes certain kinds, which are listed in Intl.Locale.prototype.getCollations.

parameters.name: numberingSystem
parameters.description: The numbering system. Any syntactically valid string following the type grammar is accepted, but the implementation only recognizes certain kinds, which are listed in Intl.Locale.prototype.getNumberingSystems.

parameters.name: caseFirst
parameters.description: The case-first sort option. Possible values are "upper", "lower", or "false".

parameters.name: hourCycle
parameters.description: The hour cycle. Possible values are "h23", "h12", "h11", or the practically unused "h24", which are explained in Intl.Locale.prototype.getHourCycles

parameters.name: numeric
parameters.description: The numeric sort option. A boolean.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.baseName
description: Returns basic, core information about the Locale in the form of a substring of the complete data string.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.calendar
description: Returns the part of the Locale that indicates the Locale's calendar era.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.caseFirst
description: Returns whether case is taken into account for the locale's collation rules.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.collation
description: Returns the collation type for the Locale, which is used to order strings according to the locale's rules.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.constructor
description: The constructor function that created the instance object. For Intl.Locale instances, the initial value is the Intl.Locale constructor.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.hourCycle
description: Returns the time keeping format convention used by the locale.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.language
description: Returns the language associated with the locale.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.numberingSystem
description: Returns the numeral system used by the locale.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.numeric
description: Returns whether the locale has special collation handling for numeric characters.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.region
description: Returns the region of the world (usually a country) associated with the locale.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.script
description: Returns the script used for writing the particular language used in the locale.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype[@@toStringTag]
description: The initial value of the @@toStringTag property is the string "Intl.Locale". This property is used in Object.prototype.toString().

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.getCalendars()
description: Returns an Array of available calendar identifiers, according to the locale's rules.
return_value:
An array of strings representing all calendars commonly used for the Locale, sorted in descending preference. If the Locale already has a calendar, then the returned array contains that single value.
Below is a list of the supported calendar era types.

parameters.name: buddhist
parameters.description: Thai Buddhist calendar

parameters.name: chinese
parameters.description: Traditional Chinese calendar

parameters.name: coptic
parameters.description: Coptic calendar

parameters.name: dangi
parameters.description: Traditional Korean calendar

parameters.name: ethioaa
parameters.description: Ethiopic calendar, Amete Alem (epoch approx. 5493 B.C.E)

parameters.name: ethiopic
parameters.description: Ethiopic calendar, Amete Mihret (epoch approx, 8 C.E.)

parameters.name: gregory
parameters.description: Gregorian calendar

parameters.name: hebrew
parameters.description: Traditional Hebrew calendar

parameters.name: indian
parameters.description: Indian calendar

parameters.name: islamic
parameters.description: Islamic calendar

parameters.name: islamic-umalqura
parameters.description: Islamic calendar, Umm al-Qura

parameters.name: islamic-tbla
parameters.description: Islamic calendar, tabular (intercalary years [2,5,7,10,13,16,18,21,24,26,29] - astronomical epoch)

parameters.name: islamic-civil
parameters.description: Islamic calendar, tabular (intercalary years [2,5,7,10,13,16,18,21,24,26,29] - civil epoch)

parameters.name: islamic-rgsa
parameters.description: Islamic calendar, Saudi Arabia sighting

parameters.name: iso8601
parameters.description: ISO calendar (Gregorian calendar using the ISO 8601 calendar week rules)

parameters.name: japanese
parameters.description: Japanese Imperial calendar

parameters.name: persian
parameters.description: Persian calendar

parameters.name: roc
parameters.description: Civil (algorithmic) Arabic calendar

parameters.name: islamicc
parameters.description:
Civil (algorithmic) Arabic calendar

Warning: The islamicc calendar key has been deprecated. Please use islamic-civil.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.getCollations()
description: Returns an Array of the collation types for the Locale.
return_value:
An array of strings representing all collation types commonly used for the Locale, sorted in alphabetical order, with the standard and search values always excluded. If the Locale already has a collation, then the returned array contains that single value.
Below is a list of the supported collation types, adapted from the Unicode collation specification.

parameters.name: big5han
parameters.description:
Pinyin ordering for Latin, big5 charset ordering for CJK characters (for Chinese)

Warning: The big5han collation type is deprecated, not available in Firefox, Chrome or Edge.

parameters.name: compat
parameters.description: A previous version of the ordering, for compatibility (for Arabic)

parameters.name: dict
parameters.description: Dictionary style ordering (for Sinhala)

parameters.name: direct
parameters.description:
Binary code point order

Warning: The direct collation type has been deprecated. Do not use.

parameters.name: ducet
parameters.description:
The default Unicode collation element table order

Warning: The ducet collation type is not available to the Web. Use the und locale without a collation type specifier instead. und is the collation that is the closest to ducet.

parameters.name: emoji
parameters.description: Recommended ordering for emoji characters (for the und locale)

parameters.name: eor
parameters.description: European ordering rules (for the und locale)

parameters.name: gb2312
parameters.description:
Pinyin ordering for Latin, gb2312han charset ordering for CJK characters (for Chinese)

Warning: The gb2312 collation type is deprecated, not available in Firefox, Chrome or Edge.

parameters.name: phonebk
parameters.description: Phonebook style ordering (for German)

parameters.name: phonetic
parameters.description: Phonetic ordering (sorting based on pronunciation; for Lingala)

parameters.name: pinyin
parameters.description: Pinyin ordering for Latin and for CJK characters (for Chinese)

parameters.name: reformed
parameters.description:
Reformed ordering (formerly for Swedish)

Warning: Do not use explicitly. This is the old name for the default ordering for Swedish whose collation naming used to differ from other languages. Since this was the default, request sv instead of requesting sv-u-co-reformed.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description:
Special collation type for string search

Warning: Do not use as a collation type, since in Intl.Collator, this collation is activated via the "search" value for the usage option. There is currently no API for substring search, so this is currently only good for filtering a list of strings by trying a full-string match of the key against each list item.

parameters.name: searchjl
parameters.description:
Special collation type for Korean initial consonant search

Warning: This collation is not for sorting, even though it is made available through Intl.Collator instantiated with usage "sort" as opposed to usage "search".

parameters.name: standard
parameters.description:
Default ordering for each language, except Chinese (and, previously, Swedish)

Warning: Do not use explicitly. In general, it's unnecessary to specify this explicitly and specifying this for Swedish is problematic due to the different meaning for Swedish in the past.

parameters.name: stroke
parameters.description: Pinyin ordering for Latin, stroke order for CJK characters (for Chinese)

parameters.name: trad
parameters.description: Traditional style ordering (such as in Spanish)

parameters.name: unihan
parameters.description:
Radical-stroke ordering for Han characters (for Chinese, Japanese, and Korean). Pinyin ordering for Latin in the case of Chinese.

Note: The unihan collation type is not available in Chrome or Edge.

parameters.name: zhuyin
parameters.description: Pinyin ordering for Latin, zhuyin order for Bopomofo and CJK characters (for Chinese)

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.getHourCycles()
description: Returns an Array of hour cycle identifiers, indicating either the 12-hour clock ("h12"), the Japanese 12-hour clock ("h11"), the 24-hour clock ("h23"), or the unused format "h24".
return_value:
An array of strings representing all hour cycle types commonly used for the Locale, sorted in descending preference. If the Locale already has an hourCycle, then the returned array contains that single value.
Below is a list of supported hour cycle types.

parameters.name: h12
parameters.description: Hour system using 1â12; corresponds to 'h' in patterns. The 12 hour clock, with midnight starting at 12:00 am. As used, for example, in the United States.

parameters.name: h23
parameters.description: Hour system using 0â23; corresponds to 'H' in patterns. The 24 hour clock, with midnight starting at 0:00.

parameters.name: h11
parameters.description: Hour system using 0â11; corresponds to 'K' in patterns. The 12 hour clock, with midnight starting at 0:00 am. Mostly used in Japan.

parameters.name: h24
parameters.description: Hour system using 1â24; corresponds to 'k' in pattern. The 24 hour clock, with midnight starting at 24:00. Not used anywhere.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.getNumberingSystems()
description: Returns an Array of numbering system identifiers available according to the locale's rules.
return_value:
An array of strings representing all numbering systems commonly used for the Locale, sorted in descending preference. If the Locale already has a numberingSystem, then the returned array contains that single value.
A table of the standard Unicode numeral systems can be seen below.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.getTextInfo()
description: Returns the part indicating the ordering of characters ltr (left-to-right) or rtl (right-to-left).
return_value:
An object representing text typesetting information associated with the Locale data specified in UTS 35's Layouts Elements. It has the following properties:

direction

A string indicating the direction of text for the locale. Can be either "ltr" (left-to-right) or "rtl" (right-to-left).

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: A string indicating the direction of text for the locale. Can be either "ltr" (left-to-right) or "rtl" (right-to-left).

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.getTimeZones()
description: Returns an Array of time zone identifiers, associated with the Locale.
return_value: An array of strings representing supported time zones for the associated Locale, where each value is an IANA time zone canonical name, sorted in alphabetical order. If the locale identifier does not contain a region subtag, the returned value is undefined.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.getWeekInfo()
description: Returns UTS 35's Week Elements according to the locale rules.
return_value:
An object representing week information associated with the Locale data specified in UTS 35's Week Elements. It has the following properties:

firstDay

An integer indicating the first day of the week for the locale. Can be either 1 (Monday) or 7 (Sunday).

weekend

An array of integers indicating the weekend days for the locale, where 1 is Monday and 7 is Sunday.

minimalDays

An integer between 1 and 7 indicating the minimal days required in the first week of a month or year, for calendar purposes.

parameters.name: firstDay
parameters.description: An integer indicating the first day of the week for the locale. Can be either 1 (Monday) or 7 (Sunday).

parameters.name: weekend
parameters.description: An array of integers indicating the weekend days for the locale, where 1 is Monday and 7 is Sunday.

parameters.name: minimalDays
parameters.description: An integer between 1 and 7 indicating the minimal days required in the first week of a month or year, for calendar purposes.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.maximize()
description: Gets the most likely values for the language, script, and region of the locale based on existing values.
return_value:
A Intl.Locale instance whose baseName property returns
  the result of the Add Likely Subtags algorithm executed against locale.baseName.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.minimize()
description: Attempts to remove information about the locale that would be added by calling maximize().
return_value:
A Intl.Locale instance whose baseName property returns
  the result of the Remove Likely Subtags algorithm
  executed against locale.baseName.

name: Intl.Locale.prototype.toString()
description: Returns the Locale's full locale identifier string.
return_value: The locale's Unicode locale identifier string.
